habitat_description: Previously considered part of Plethodon richmondi (Southern Ravine salamander), Highton (1999) determined Plethodon electromorphus to be distinct from P. richmondi on the basis of protein characteristics detectable by eletrophoresis. P. electromorphus inhabits hardwood forested slopes with friable soils and flat rocks and occasionally stream margins, avoiding dry ridge crests and valley floors as well as excessively moist areas (Minton 1972, 2001, Regester 2000, Beamer and Lannoo 2005). Rocks and talus slopes are the preferred, almost exclusive cover types for this species (Wood 1945, Minton 1972, 2001).
